Debrief.synopsis: Jergal's debrief at MOO after the mind flayer colony.
Debrief.how_to_trigger: Debug Book -> Set quest flags -> Act 2 -> SCE - Epilogue -> Go off-path -> Block Jaheira, Florrick and Minthara -> Start the debrief for his debrief, but he always appears regardless of which path players take.

AD_EpilogueIntro.synopsis: Withers AD's on the player successfully defeating Ketheric and coming back to the Epilogue.

AD.synopsis: Jergal is always present at the epilogue and will try to call for the player's attention. He has important things to say to the player in his debrief about the dead three and what to do next. It will only play before SCE_Jergal_Debrief triggers.

Debrief_24.speaker: Withers
Debrief_24.text: Selûne's light extinguished, thy hunger quenched. The scales tip, weighted by blood thou spilt.

Debrief_19.speaker: Withers
Debrief_19.text: Thou hast seen with thine own eyes and felt in thine Urges: the Dead Three unite.

Debrief_26.speaker: Withers
Debrief_26.text: The shadows yet fester. The Dead Three, united under cover of darkness. The balance shifts.

Debrief_68.speaker: Narrator
Debrief_68.text: *The Dead Three. Myrkul, Bane, and Bhaal - lords of deathly tenets, and traitors to Ao, god of gods.*

Debrief_76.speaker: Narrator
Debrief_76.text: *All three sowed chaos at the height of their power. And all three now walk the planes as mortals - or so it's believed.*

Debrief_22.speaker: Withers
Debrief_22.text: There are depths to this alliance yet unplumbed. Consider, mortal:

Debrief_54.speaker: Player
Debrief_54.text: Forget that. What are you doing here, Withers?

Debrief_62.speaker: Player
Debrief_62.text: Forget that. What are you doing here, Withers?

Debrief_88.speaker: Player
Debrief_88.text: Forget that. What are you doing here, Withers?

Debrief_57.speaker: Player
Debrief_57.text: Forget that. Who are you? What are you doing here?

Debrief_99.speaker: Withers
Debrief_99.text: I shall ask yet again. Do illithids possess souls?

Debrief_113.speaker: Player
Debrief_113.text: I'm not sure. Don't all living things?

Debrief_102.speaker: Withers
Debrief_102.text: No. Nor canst thou count mind flayers among them.

Debrief_51.speaker: Player
Debrief_51.text: I admit I haven't thought about it.

Debrief_25.speaker: Withers
Debrief_25.text: Thou shalt think about it now, and I shall give the answer. Mind flayers are soulless.

Debrief_93.speaker: Withers
Debrief_93.text: Yet the Three amass an illithid army, void of apostolic souls that could imbue them with power.

Debrief_40.speaker: Withers
Debrief_40.text: A flock without souls - yet to what end, O tempted one? This is the question thou must come to answer.

Debrief_86.speaker: Withers
Debrief_86.text: Until such time, be availed of my services.

Debrief_84.speaker: Player
Debrief_84.text: I'm surprised to see you. Why are you here?

Debrief_118.speaker: Player
Debrief_118.text: I'm surprised to see you. Why are you here?

Debrief_5.speaker: Player
Debrief_5.text: I'm surprised to see you. Why are you here?

Debrief_2.speaker: Withers
Debrief_2.text: Where matters of balance are concerned, I am eternally called.

Debrief_6.speaker: Player
Debrief_6.text: Who are you? What are you doing here?

Debrief_123.speaker: Withers
Debrief_123.text: There are many answers to those questions. None are important.

Debrief_1.speaker: Withers
Debrief_1.text: For sake of convenience, thou shalt call me Withers.

Debrief_43.speaker: Player
Debrief_43.text: Serving Shar is all I have ever known. What should I do now?

Debrief_30.speaker: Withers
Debrief_30.text: Thou knowest the answer to this already. The daughter of Selûne, whose blood thou left unspilled, revealed long-hidden truths. Thou must win back that which was taken.

Debrief_100.speaker: Withers
Debrief_100.text: Seek the daughter of Selûne, whose blood thou left unspilled. There are truths yet to be spoken.

Debrief_47.speaker: Player
Debrief_47.text: You know of these Urges. What can you tell me?

Debrief_96.speaker: Withers
Debrief_96.text: Nothing thou dost not already know.

Debrief_79.speaker: Player
Debrief_79.text: Speak plainly. Isn't there more you can tell me?

Debrief_92.speaker: Player
Debrief_92.text: Can the Dead Three hope to reclaim full godhood?

Debrief_14.speaker: Withers
Debrief_14.text: For the divine appointees of Ao, even death can be overcome.

Debrief_11.speaker: Withers
Debrief_11.text: The alliance is reforged, mortal. The planes thus quake, and the gods shudder.

Debrief_36.speaker: Player
Debrief_36.text: You seem to know a lot about the Dead Three.

Debrief_56.speaker: Withers
Debrief_56.text: Yes. Bane, Lord of Darkness. Bhaal, Lord of Murder. Myrkul, Lord of Bones.

Debrief_65.speaker: Withers
Debrief_65.text: Once judged, ascended, then vanquished, as one and as three.

Debrief_10.speaker: Withers
Debrief_10.text: A mending of the threads between life and death.

Debrief_31.speaker: Withers
Debrief_31.text: Should thou or any of thy compatriots perish, I will cleave soul to body once more.

Debrief_77.speaker: Withers
Debrief_77.text: Then thou must provide the proper payment.

Debrief_53.speaker: Withers
Debrief_53.text: This is the price of balance. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

Debrief_66.speaker: Withers
Debrief_66.text: Well counted. I recommend keeping thy distance for a moment.

Debrief_60.speaker: Player
Debrief_60.text: Changed my mind. They can stay dead for now.

Debrief_37.speaker: Player
Debrief_37.text: I want to resurrect all of my fallen companions. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Debrief_117.speaker: Withers
Debrief_117.text: This is the price of balance. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_2_463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])

Debrief_29.speaker: Player
Debrief_29.text: I want to manage my hirelings.

Debrief_42.speaker: Player
Debrief_42.text: I would like to recruit a hireling. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_3_01f129ea-b4dc-44b6-8154-9a948f876a82])

Debrief_44.speaker: Withers
Debrief_44.text: Patience. Thy colleague still peruses my ledger.

Debrief_8.speaker: Withers
Debrief_8.text: Thou canst not hire allies. I must speak with thy leader.

Debrief_90.speaker: Withers
Debrief_90.text: One of thy hirelings waits in thy camp.

Debrief_50.speaker: Withers
Debrief_50.text: Two of thy hirelings wait in thy camp.

Debrief_45.speaker: Withers
Debrief_45.text: All three of thy hirelings wait in thy camp.

Debrief_69.speaker: Withers
Debrief_69.text: No. Thy coinpurse is near empty.

Debrief_59.speaker: Player
Debrief_59.text: I would like to dismiss a hireling.

Debrief_61.speaker: Withers
Debrief_61.text: There is no one to dismiss.

Debrief_55.speaker: Withers
Debrief_55.text: Only thy leader may banish hirelings.

Debrief_21.speaker: Player
Debrief_21.text: I would like to change my appearance or class.

Debrief_122.speaker: Withers
Debrief_122.text: Thou hast broken thy oath. Before I can aid thee, thou must atone.

Debrief_105.speaker: Withers
Debrief_105.text: A flock without souls - yet to what end, mortal? This is the question thou must come to answer.

Debrief_63.speaker: Withers
Debrief_63.text: Thy hunger denied. Selûne's faithful yet shines. The balance shifts.

Debrief_67.speaker: Withers
Debrief_67.text: One goddess mourns her daughter, slain by thy hand. Yet her sister rejoices in the blood, and bestows honours upon thy head.

Debrief_73.speaker: Withers
Debrief_73.text: The Dead Three stand united. Shalt thou have the strength to face them?

Debrief_71.speaker: Withers
Debrief_71.text: Fate spins along as it should. Hast thou need of my services?

Debrief_87.speaker: Withers
Debrief_87.text: Thou hast angered thy goddess, yet spared the child of another. A curious turn.

Debrief_121.speaker: Withers
Debrief_121.text: A curse lifted. The Dead Three, allied once more. The balance shifts.

AD_EpilogueIntro_0.speaker: Withers
AD_EpilogueIntro_0.text: Against all odds, thou hast survived. Wilt thou reflect with me upon thy triumph?

AD_0.speaker: Withers
AD_0.text: Make haste. I would have words with you.
AD_0.context: NodeContext: Calling for the player's attention

AD_1.speaker: Withers
AD_1.text: New perils await, beyond the horizon.
AD_1.context: NodeContext: Calling for the player's attention

AD_2.speaker: Withers
AD_2.text: Come. There are important matters to discuss.
AD_2.context: NodeContext: Calling for the player's attention

AD_3.speaker: Withers
AD_3.text: Thou dawdlest while time is precious. Let us speak.
AD_3.context: NodeContext: Calling for the player's attention
